original_solution_mapping.L1: 1 roll can wrap 5 shirt boxes and he has 20 shirts boxes to wrap so he needs 20/5 = <<20/5=4>>4 rolls of wrap
original_solution_mapping.L2: 1 roll can wrap 3 XL boxes and he has 12 XL boxes to wrap so he needs 12/3 = <<12/3=4>>4 rolls or wrap
original_solution_mapping.L3: All total he needs 4+4 = <<4+4=8>>8 rolls of wrap
original_solution_mapping.L4: Each roll costs $4.00 and he needs 8 rolls so it will cost him 4*8 = $<<4*8=32.00>>32.00 in wrapping paper

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5837.
    Returns: the total cost to wrap all boxes.
    """
    # L1
    total_shirt_boxes = 20 # 20 shirt boxes to wrap
    shirt_boxes_per_roll = 5 # 5 shirt boxes
    rolls_for_shirts = total_shirt_boxes / shirt_boxes_per_roll

    # L2
    total_xl_boxes = 12 # 12 XL boxes to wrap
    xl_boxes_per_roll = 3 # 3 XL boxes
    rolls_for_xl = total_xl_boxes / xl_boxes_per_roll

    # L3
    total_rolls_needed = rolls_for_shirts + rolls_for_xl

    # L4
    cost_per_roll = 4.00 # $4.00 per roll
    total_cost = cost_per_roll * total_rolls_needed

    # FA
    answer = total_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: 1 roll can wrap {shirt_boxes_per_roll} shirt boxes and he has {total_shirt_boxes} shirts boxes to wrap so he needs {total_shirt_boxes}/{shirt_boxes_per_roll} = <<{total_shirt_boxes}/{shirt_boxes_per_roll}={rolls_for_shirts}>>{rolls_for_shirts} rolls of wrap

1 roll can wrap {xl_boxes_per_roll} XL boxes and he has {total_xl_boxes} XL boxes to wrap so he needs {total_xl_boxes}/{xl_boxes_per_roll} = <<{total_xl_boxes}/{xl_boxes_per_roll}={rolls_for_xl}>>{rolls_for_xl} rolls or wrap
All total he needs {rolls_for_shirts}+{rolls_for_xl} = <<{rolls_for_shirts}+{rolls_for_xl}={total_rolls_needed}>>{total_rolls_needed} rolls of wrap

Each roll costs ${cost_per_roll} and he needs {total_rolls_needed} rolls so it will cost him {cost_per_roll}*{total_rolls_needed} = $<<{cost_per_roll}*{total_rolls_needed}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} in wrapping paper

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: 1 roll can wrap 3 XL boxes and he has 3 XL boxes to wrap so he needs 3/3 = <<3/3=1>>1 rolls or wrap

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Each roll costs $4 and he needs 5 rolls so it will cost him 4*5 = $<<4*5=20>>20 in wrapping paper

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'xl_boxes_per_roll' (3) was used instead of 'total_xl_boxes' (12).
